page.title: 02 THE KILSYTH HILLS
page.content: These hills, which form much of our block, were formed by lava.This molten rock first appeared between two million and four million years ago. They are part of a range of hills known as the{Campsie Fells}which run for over 20 miles across Central Scotland.They reach a height of over 450 metres,and can be seen from Glasgow,17 miles away. The hills are used for many purposes. The upper slopes form rough grazing for sheep,with cattle on the lush, lower levels.The open nature of the hills is broken by only a few patches of deciduous woods. A few old quarries and mine shafts can still be seen,and a reservoir which stores fresh water. The hills are also a good place for leisure e.g.walking,fishing,bird-watching.
